thread.title: Livestream of pregnant giraffe is driving the web crazy | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Livestream of pregnant giraffe is driving the web crazy | Daily Mail Online

author: Jordan Gass-Poore For Dailymail.Com
title: Livestream of pregnant giraffe is driving the web crazy | Daily Mail Online
text: comments They say patience is a virtue. This couldn't be any more true than in the case of the millions of viewers who've rallied around a YouTube livestream of a pregnant giraffe for days. April, a 15-year-old giraffe at Animal Adventure Park in Harpursville, New York, is expected to give birth to her fourth calf any day now. Giraffe pregnancies last about 15 months. Labor can take anywhere from a few hours to a few days. April, a 15-year-old giraffe at Animal Adventure Park in Harpursville, New York (above) is expected to give birth to her fourth calf any day now Childbirth can be a real pain in the neck: Giraffe pregnancies last about 15 months. Labor can take anywhere from a few hours to a few days Zoo keepers noted that April’s appetite has waned, which is a good sign of imminent labor Fans were recently treated to a clip of April's baby twisting and turning in her stomach Zoo keepers have noted that April’s appetite is dropping off a bit, which is a good sign of imminent labor. On Thursday, the livestream abruptly ended after activists complained that the video contained nudity and sexual content. But under pressure from viewers YouTube reinstated it. The steam, which may have gone unnoticed, made headlines after the controversy. Animal rights activists complained that April's YouTube livestream was sexually explicit Fans were recently treated to a clip of April's baby twisting and turning in her stomach. The mommy-to-be and her partner Oliver, 5, will be welcoming their first child together. The calf will weigh around 150 pounds and stand about six feet tall at birth. No one knows when April's new calf will arrive, but viewers can enjoy nature taking its course - and think of a name for the newborn to submit to the zoo's contest. Once the calf is born and its sex is determined, Animal Adventures will post a contest announcement on their social media platforms where users can submit their name suggestions. April has become a worldwide sensation, causing some animal lovers to share memes that capture the anticipation. RELATED ARTICLES
